channel.title: Which 3d library shall I use?
channel.description:
Well, I am running linux (32bit and 64-bit) and I'm trying to create a 3d app. My problem is, that I want my applet to be multi-platform compliant. I looked up JOGL and I need to download a library that is platform specific.
Do I need to create my own 3d library, or is there an open source 3d library out there for me that I can use?

item.title: Which 3d library shall I use?
item.dc:creator: @VB7_Rocks VB7 Rocks
item.description:
@VB7_Rocks wrote:

[quote=“Cheese_Police, post:8, topic:172886”]http://jmonkeyengine.com/

It may still be in “development”, but it is well complete enough to use; plus it kicks ass.[/quote]

Is it just me, or does anybody else absolutely hate having to go through CVS to download any sort of stuff from Java.net?

Read full topic

item.title: Which 3d library shall I use?
item.dc:creator: @Cheese_Police c|p
item.description:

http://jmonkeyengine.com/

It may still be in “development”, but it is well complete enough to use; plus it kicks ass.

item.title: Which 3d library shall I use?
item.dc:creator: @Rajae Rajae
item.description:
@Rajae wrote:

[quote=“Taharok, post:2, topic:172886”]How about Java 3D:

https://java3d.dev.java.net/

download: http://java.sun.com/javase/technologies/desktop/techoverview.jsp#java3d

Java 3D is built on top of OpenGL or DirectX. You can manipulate it with easy integration depending on the platform the user is running. Look it up.[/quote]
Heard it’s not too great, and the FPS isn’t too great

[quote=“Krichevskoy, post:3, topic:172886”]LWJGL is packaged for multi-platform use.
http://lwjgl.org/installation.php[/quote]
Haven’t heard about that library, but i’m gonna try it out. It also has openAL, which is quite useful.

sppt:

JOGL is multi-platform aswell afaik, but you’ll need to include the different jars for them

Too many JARs

[quote=“darkdemun”]MissSilabSoft says:
Use neengine
http://silabsoft.no-ip.org/downloads/nengine.jar[/quote][quote=“BAsh(CntLgn), post:5, topic:172886”]neengine really isn’t very popular or it isn’t in the top ten at google. I recommend something a bit more refined and supported. Its like using BCEL rather than ASM. You should be getting a real library.[/quote]
^^

Read full topic

item.title: Which 3d library shall I use?
item.dc:creator: @tL tL
item.description:
@tL wrote:

I’m pretty sure neengine is newbiehackers.

Read full topic

item.title: Which 3d library shall I use?
item.dc:creator: @BAsh_CntLgn BAsh(CntLgn)
item.description:
@BAsh_CntLgn wrote:

neengine really isn’t very popular or it isn’t in the top ten at google. I recommend something a bit more refined and supported. Its like using BCEL rather than ASM. You should be getting a real library.

Read full topic

item.title: Which 3d library shall I use?
item.dc:creator: @mod_taharok Taharok
item.description:
@mod_taharok wrote:

How about Java 3D:

https://java3d.dev.java.net/

download: http://java.sun.com/javase/technologies/desktop/techoverview.jsp#java3d

Java 3D is built on top of OpenGL or DirectX. You can manipulate it with easy integration depending on the platform the user is running. Look it up.

Read full topic
